ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.

Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:

Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Improved my Spanish a lot! My reading and listening skills improved significantly and so did my speaking skills. Learned a lot of grammar and vocabulary, as well as some cultural topics
Strengthened my conversational Spanish skills and learned a lot about culture
I furthered my Spanish speaking abilities.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Strength - Professor Tortora was amazing! She was very kind and understanding. I was a bit nervous coming into this class because it was taught in Spanish, but she really helped you get comfortable with speaking. She also taught very well and made some of the more difficult aspects of Spanish grammar easier to understand. She also made frequent announcements that were helpful in knowing when things were due, especially because there are so many assignments and activities. Another strength is the different types of activities. The listening and oral presentations were very helpful in improving my listening and speaking skills. Weakness - the course does move pretty fast so you learn a lot every week, which isn't too bad, but for retention sometimes it's not the best. I also would've preferred a bit more listening practice. Also although they had the mesa de espaol, i feel like they should've incorporated that in the course, or at least offer other times because I wasn't able to attend any.
Every assignment you do goes towards your grade, which makes the class stressful and makes it easy to dislike the course. Too many graded assignments.

Strengths: lots of engagement, a lot of opportunities to practice speaking & writing without being an overwhelming amount of work

Weaknesses: a 93 isn't considered an A
It was challenging to learn Spanish remotely. The fact that it was every day was good because it made us engage with the content every day.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I think the class functioned well with the Zoom format. Having the two asynchronous days was nice as well. Definitely helped with the large daily workload.

I really liked the two asynchronous days a week where we worked on assignments on our own time in addition to the three discussions per week. I found that more helpful than a purely discussion-based format would have been.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I would! This course will really improve your Spanish and you will learn a lot! Just know that it is a lot of work every day so you have to be ready to put in the time. If you do, take it with Professor Tortora! She is a gem and very knowledgeable about Spanish and Spanish culture.
Only take it if youre already good at Spanish, or if youre willing to let it dominate your schedule.

Yup. It's very thorough and requires you to practice every component of Spanish, rather than just reading & writing. The listening, speaking, and writing portions challenged me without ever feeling overwhelmed. I often found Spanish a nice respite from my STEM classes.
Yes, this class made learning Spanish an engaging, entertaining, and uncomplicated experience.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
